results.title: Alcohol and tobacco: what they do to our bodies
results.brief_description: Laboratory tests are used to show the effects of alcohol on the human body. A comparison is made of the skill and ability of a juggler and an athlete before and after smoking and drinking.

results.title: Alcohol and the human body
results.brief_description: Explains the source of alcohol in liquours produced by fermentation from wheat, grapes, corn and other plants. Diagrams show what happens to alcohol in the human body, how it deadens the judgement centres, affects the vision, slows up muscle responsivenss and may result in unconsciousness. The problem drunkard is diagnosed as a sick person requiring medical treatment. Alcohol is shown to be a social problem as well as a personal health issue.

results.title: Alcohol and drugs in the workplace
results.brief_description: An information and training video and accompanying trainer’s manual about alcohol and drug use in the workplace. Contrary to the popular perception that people with alcohol or other drug related problems are unemployed or disenfranchised, 60-70% are in full-time employment. Of all workplace accidents 20-30% involve people in an intoxicated state. This video aims to demonstrate the extent of the cost, both to industry and the individual, of drug and alcohol use in the workplace. It deals with the responsibilities of industry and co-workers, and outlines employee assistance programs that will help those suffering from dependency problems.

results.title: Albury: year round holiday centre
results.brief_description: A look at Albury, holiday and convention city, and its surrounding resorts. Shows the numerous amenities they can offer to the tourist or visitor. Points of interest seen are Lake Hume, Beechworth and its historic buildings and Mount Beauty and skiing at Falls Creek. No further credits available.

results.title: Alberta girls
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Malca Gillson and Tony Ianzelo
results.brief_description: The film follows the Alberta All-girls drum and bugle band at the opening ceremonies of the World Cup Soccer Championship at Munich, Olympic Stadium, and their tour around Germany.

results.title: Albert Speer: the last nazi
results.creator_credit: Global Television Network, Lakeville Group, W.R. Callaghan and Brian Nolan
results.brief_description: Several years after his release from Spandau prison, where he completed his twenty-year sentence for war crimes, Albert Speer is interviewed by Canadian reporter Patrick Watson. The interview reveals Speer’s assessment of his life, and chronicles the rise and fall of the Nazi regime, shedding light on the behaviour of a great many Germans who fell under Hitler’s spell. Valuable documentary footage, including some of Speer’s home movies.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Global Television Network, Lakeville Group, W.R. Callaghan and Brian Nolan

results.title: Albert Gleizes
results.creator_credit: Les Films du Cypres and Pierre Alibert
results.brief_description: Presents the painter who, early in his career, began experimenting with structure to rediscover form, which eventually led to Cubism. Successive treatments of one subject painted by Gleizes are compared in their cubistic development and the laws of painting, which Gleizes defined, are demonstrated through examples in his own work.
